speaker: Doctor
text: "Can you tell me more about when you first noticed the fever and abdominal tenderness? Was it shortly after delivery, or did it start a few days after?"

speaker: Patient
text: "I think it started a few days after delivery, maybe around 2-3 days after the birth. I just felt a little warm and uncomfortable, and when I went to use the bathroom, I noticed that I had to pee more often than usual. It was just a mild discomfort, but it's been getting a bit worse."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Okay, so the fever and discomfort started around 2-3 days postpartum, and you've noticed an increase in urination frequency. Can you tell me if you've experienced any other symptoms such as nausea, vomiting, or any unusual bleeding from the umbilical site?"

speaker: Patient
text: "I've had a bit of a decrease in bowel movements, to be honest. It's like my body is trying to, uh, 'let go' more often, but I'm not really producing as much. And I have to say, I've been feeling a bit...off, like my insides aren't quite working the way they should be."

speaker: Doctor
text:
"REQUEST TEST: Blood_Culture"

Also, I'd like you to show me the abdominal tenderness more clearly. Can you move your belly for me and point out where it hurts the most?"

text: "Okay, I'd like to request another test. Can you tell me if you've experienced any vomiting or if you've noticed any changes in your bowel movements, such as diarrhea or constipation?"

text: "Actually, I have been feeling a bit queasy, and I've had some changes in my bowel movements. I've been experiencing more gas and bloating, and I think I've had some... loose stools.
